meanings.definition: Causing or showing a fondness for causing trouble in a playful way.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous puppy chewed on my shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The children's mischievous giggles filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her mischievous smile hinted at her upcoming prank.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous glint in his eyes gave away his intentions.

meanings.definition: Playfully annoying or causing trouble in a harmless way.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous kitten batted at the dangling string.
meanings.sent2: She had a mischievous twinkle in her eye as she teased her friend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind kept blowing the hat off his head.
meanings.sent4: His mischievous sense of humor always lightened the mood.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous dance of the leaves in the wind was mesmerizing.
